ref: 3328 kuruvinda m.n. ʻ ruby ʼ Suśr., n. ʻ black salt, the stone cinnabar ʼ lex.
Pa. kuruvinda -- m. ʻ ruby, cinnabar (?) ʼ, ˚aka -- ʻ vermilion ʼ;
S. kuriṇḍru m. ʻ pumice -- stone, any preparation used in place of it for polishing ʼ;
P. kuruṇḍ m. ʻ corundum stone ʼ;
N. kurin ʻ a kind of stone for sharpening tools and making bullets ʼ;
H. kuraṇḍ m. ʻ corundum stone, whetstone ʼ;
M. kurũd m. ʻ corundum (a reddish soft stone used for mills, whetstones, etc.), red speck on white of eye ʼ;
Si. kurun̆du ʻ cinnamon ʼ, kurun̆du -- gal ʻ cinnamon -- stone ʼ, kuruvilla ʻ ruby ʼ.
